title: 820-00239: Backlight Issue (Backlight goes out when adjusted)
message:
I have this unit that is having a backlight issue. It boots up completely to OS and runs, but when i attempt to adjust the backlight intensity, i then loose backlight and can't get it back. I still have image on the screen (can see the image when i shine a light on the screen). On other occasions, if i don't mess with the backlight intensity, it will eventually start to flicker out and then go out completely. 

I've checked for corrosion or liquid spill/damage and found none

I'm at a loss as to where to start with this one. Any suggestions?

title: 820-00239: Backlight Issue (Backlight goes out when adjusted)
message:
Check if the machine can get screen replaced free by Apple first.
If not, then try known good compatible LCD assembly.
Display itself is involved in backlight (PWM) adjust...

title: 820-00239: Backlight Issue (Backlight goes out when adjusted)
message: I replaced the display twice. At First when i got the machine in, it powered up but with no backlight. So i ordered a replacement display after I tested the unit with another display. The first display that arrived i thought was defective due to the flickering backlight. But had the same issue on the second display. So i reinstalled the original display and the backlight worked until I then attempted to adjust the intensity, then it dropped out. Upon power cycling the unit, the display worked again, until i reattempt intensity adjustment.

title: 820-00239: Backlight Issue (Backlight goes out when adjusted)
message: Did you change only the LCD display, or LCD assembly entire?

title: 820-00239: Backlight Issue (Backlight goes out when adjusted)
message: Replaced the whole assembly both times. I try to avoid doing just the lcd on these models.

title: 820-00239: Backlight Issue (Backlight goes out when adjusted)
message:
Would you happen to know what chip sets the backlight intensity when we adjust it on the laptop? Whenever the backlight drops out,
PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT drops from 13v to down to about 1v.
I've replaced U8400, and Q8400. with the same result.

title: 820-00239: Backlight Issue (Backlight goes out when adjusted)
message:
CPU talks with LCD display and this one send final info to U8400.
SMC is somehow involved too.
Just search for BKLT_PWM in schematic...
